title: "Al-Ghazali - On disciplining the soul" book cover
content:
Dear all   
   
I wonder if someone can give us a hand trying to find out which are the fonts (or the font if it is only one) used on this titling for a book cover. So far we have only found Trajan and ITC Cerigo that ressemble the sample, but note the flat tip of the upper case A (unlike Trajan), and also the sans-serif middle bar of the E. The ampersand, being uncommon, should be relatively easy to track down, but we have not come across something like it within a font ressembling the other characters. Please disregard the long vowel marks and the underdots, unless you have some specific information.   
   
MANY THANKS IN ADVANCE!   
   
JA ![ghazali jpeg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224621im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42430.jpg)
author: juan_acevedo

comments.content:
I can see why you liked Cerigo for a bit, with the odd serifs on the A and the unserifed middle arm of the E. Matthew Carter's Alisal also has both of these features, but other letters do not match, including the italic.   
   
I'm still hunting...

The italic in the sample is more calligraphic than slimbach... it would be helpful to know the source and when it's from. Could be pre-digital? Shares some character traits with Bembo, like the cap A, but it is not Bembo.
Juan - contact the publisher - The Islamic Texts Society - [www.its.org.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516224621/http:/www.its.org.uk/)
